## Description

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is soliciting bids for Elder Helper Services to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders. The contract will involve providing spiritual support and guidance to Indigenous offenders, while respecting their cultural traditions.

## Statement of Qualification

To be considered for this contract, bidders must demonstrate a minimum of two years of experience in the following areas:

* Assisting and supporting an Elder
* Providing counseling and guidance according to traditions and teachings
* Conducting group discussions
* Assisting others in preparing reports (verbal and written)

Candidates must provide a resume and two (2) references to support their claim.

## Deliverables

The successful bidder will provide the following services:

* Ensure offenders approach the Elder providing services according to traditional protocol
* Ensure an adequate supply of traditional ceremonial material is available
* Coordinate and supervise offenders during traditional ceremonies
* Conduct group discussions and teachings with the Elder's agreement
* Assist staff in preparing reports and provide technical support for case management and parole processes
* Provide counseling services to offenders when the Elder is unavailable
* Participate in staff meetings to enhance teamwork and create a healthy support network

## Reporting and Communication

The successful bidder will provide two-weekly time sheets to confirm services provided, as well as bi-weekly activity reports summarizing services provided.

## Security Requirements

The contract includes security requirements, including a Reliability Status granted by the CSC.

## Exclusion and Limitations

This procurement is set-aside for Indigenous suppliers, in accordance with the Government of Canada's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business.

## Closing Date and Time

January 10, 2024, at 2:00
